title: Design webhook event framework for claim status notifications
summary: Develop a webhook infrastructure to notify clients of insurance claim status changes, including submitted, in review, approved, rejected, and paid statuses. The framework should support standardized event types, extensibility, and integration with claims APIs. Scalability, reliability, and compliance for high-volume financial processing are required.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: Implement a webhook-based notification system for insurance API claim status changes (submitted, in review, approved, rejected, paid).

title: Implement client endpoint registration with event selection
summary: Enable clients to register webhook endpoints and select which claim status events should trigger notifications. The registration process must be secure and support customization for each integration profile.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: Clients must be able to register endpoints, select events, and define custom data fields per integration profile.

title: Enable per-client custom field mapping in webhook payloads
summary: Allow each client integration to define custom data fields within webhook payloads, enabling tailored data delivery to suit client-specific requirements and systems. Support mapping and management of custom fields on a per-client basis.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: Clients must be able to ... define custom data fields per integration profile.

title: Validate custom fields for conflicts, naming, and type constraints
summary: Provide validation logic to check custom fields defined by clients for reserved word conflicts, proper naming conventions, and allowed data types in webhook payloads. Ensure data integrity and prevent misconfiguration during client onboarding.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: The system must validate custom fields (check for reserved word conflicts, naming/type constraints)...

title: Implement webhook schema validation and reject conflicts with detailed errors
summary: Add webhook schema validation to reject conflicting schemas and provide clients with detailed error messages for resolution. This reduces onboarding errors and improves developer experience.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: Edge cases include schema conflicts (reject with detailed errors)...

title: Develop retry logic for failed webhook deliveries with exponential backoff
summary: Implement robust retry logic for failed webhook deliveries using exponential backoff strategies to maximize successful delivery rates and ensure reliability even during transient outages.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: Reliability is ensured via retry with exponential backoff...

title: Notify clients on persistent webhook delivery failures
summary: Trigger alerts or notifications to clients when webhook deliveries have failed after all retry attempts, ensuring clients are informed of delivery issues in a timely manner.

title: Provide clients with delivery status and logs via API or dashboard
summary: Expose webhook delivery status and logs to clients through an API or dashboard, supporting transparency, troubleshooting, and operational visibility for ongoing integrations.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: Reliability is ensured via ... delivery logs/status (API/dashboard)...

title: Require endpoint verification using shared secret or signed payloads
summary: Enforce that webhook endpoints are verified using either a pre-shared secret or cryptographically signed payloads, bolstering security and guarding against spoofed or unauthorized notification delivery.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: The system must ... enforce endpoint verification (shared secret/signed payloads)...

title: Allow clients to manage, pause, or revoke webhook registrations via self-service portal
summary: Provide a client self-service portal for managing webhook registrations, including pausing or revoking endpoints, supporting operational agility and usability improvements for client teams.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: support managing webhook registrations via a portal.

title: Log all webhook events, payloads, and delivery outcomes for compliance and troubleshooting
summary: All webhook event activity—including incoming payloads, delivery attempts, and results—must be logged thoroughly to support compliance, auditing, and incident troubleshooting. Logging must be granular enough to reconstruct event flows, trace failures, and demonstrate regulatory adherence.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: Reliability is ensured via retry with exponential backoff, delivery logs/status (API/dashboard), and notification on persistent failures.

title: Implement rate limiting for high-frequency webhook clients and notify on threshold breaches
summary: Introduce rate limiting controls on webhook endpoints to mitigate abuse and ensure reliability for all users. Clients exceeding configured thresholds must be notified promptly, supporting policy transparency and proactive correction.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: Edge cases include schema conflicts (reject with detailed errors) and rate limiting for high-frequency clients.

title: Produce and maintain sample payloads, setup guides, and troubleshooting documentation
summary: Comprehensive sample payloads, integration setup guides, and troubleshooting documentation must be maintained and updated. These resources improve usability, aid onboarding, and help clients efficiently address common integration issues.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: Non-functionals: ... provide usability features like sample payloads, setup docs, and support team training.

title: Train support teams on common webhook integration issues
summary: Support teams must receive training focused on typical webhook integration challenges and troubleshooting techniques. This enables effective assistance to clients, reducing time to resolution and support escalations.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: Non-functionals: ... provide usability features like ... support team training.

title: Upgrade insurance claims processing system and API to support webhooks
summary: The insurance claims processing system and its API must be updated to integrate webhook event triggers. This foundational upgrade enables asynchronous claim status notifications and seamless downstream integration.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: Dependencies include upgrades to core claims processing and API.

title: Ensure webhook system scalability for high enterprise event volumes
summary: The webhook system must be architected and tested for scalability, supporting high enterprise event loads without performance degradation. This ensures continued reliability, even under surge conditions or severe loads.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: Non-functionals: scale for enterprise event volume, maintain compliance...

title: Deliver webhook management UI and backend logic
summary: Develop a user interface and backend logic to provide clients with the tools necessary for configuring, managing, and monitoring webhook registrations. The solution must prioritize usability and seamless integration with existing enterprise systems.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: Clients must be able to register endpoints, select events, and define custom data fields per integration profile.

title: Supply compliance and monitoring scripts for webhook operations
summary: Provide scripts designed for compliance audits and operational monitoring of webhook infrastructure. These scripts enable regular health checks, anomaly detection, and fulfilment of regulatory requirements.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: Supply compliance and monitoring scripts for webhook operations.

title: Develop and provide client and support training guides
summary: Create and share comprehensive training guides tailored for both clients and internal support staff, ensuring effective webhook integration, onboarding efficiency, and empowered troubleshooting.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: Non-functionals: ... provide usability features like sample payloads, setup docs, and support team training.
